H0.text: Chemical energy is the type of energy that respiration releases from glucose, which is used for processes such as growth of the body.

H1.text: Kinetic energy is the type of energy released by respiration, a process that releases energy from glucose to support body growth.

H2.text: Potential energy is the type of energy released during respiration, the process that liberates energy from glucose for processes such as growth of the body.

H3.text: Thermal is the type of energy released by respiration, a process during which energy is released from glucose and used for processes such as growth of the body.

A4.text: The chemical energy stored in ATP (the bond of its third phosphate group to the rest of the molecule can be broken, allowing more stable products to form, thereby releasing energy for use by the cell)

A5.text: Cellular respiration is the process of oxidizing biological fuels using an inorganic electron acceptor, such as oxygen, to drive production of adenosine triphosphate (ATP), which stores chemical energy in a biologically accessible form
